fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20669].
  {panel}

Many users are finding the new 4.1 UI unpleasant to the point of not upgrading. If the new UI were optional this would be less of a problem.
See the extended discussion of this at http://forums.atlassian.com/message.jspa?messageID=257335567&tstart=0

{panel:title=Atlassian update for 10 July 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi guys,

Many thanks for all the feedback and comments throughout the time this issue has been raised.

It's been more than four years and we've addressed most of the initial feedback on the JIRA view issue page so we think it is time to close this feedback issue with the recent release of JIRA 6.3. If you have any more feedback please search for existing issues and comment on them or raise them as new issues if they don't yet exist.

Many thanks,

Roy Krishna
JIRA Product Management
roy at atlassian dot com
{panel}
fields.summary: Feedback for view issue page
Activity stream will not show issue type icon if the icon URL is not using relative path

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20636].
  {panel}

Hello,

as a team of systems administrators, we would like to get the full group memberships of our customers displayed in the User Profile page, in order to better identify them, without being added to the jira-administrators group.
In fact, our customers are colleagues of ours who do not belong to technical divisions; however, we would like to replicate their position from the corporate organisation chart to JIRA.
Is there a way to accomplish that?

Thanks,
Gabriele
fields.summary: Displaying group memberships of a user in the User Profile page
JIRA consumes too much memory when processing emails if the mail box contains large numbers of messages
Improve AbstractCommentHandler to append email to body of comments when user is anonymous
Update the Web-items documentation re REST

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20616].
  {panel}

For the last 4 months I been using JIRA a lot.  As JIRA bug master I have a "reason" to really use JIRA.  And the way it works affects the way I can work.

I think JIRA needs a new feature.  Lets call them Lists.

A JIRA List is simply a set issues that have be "placed" together into the list.  Simple as that.

h2. Why Not Filters
Filters are "views" on some data.  If the issue data has matching attributes, then it presented by the filter.  When it not longer
has matching attributes, its not.

Lists differ in that once an issue is added to the list, it stays there.  An issue's data attributes can change as much as you
like but they are still in the list.

One does have to ensure that the data stays stable with lists compared to filters.  If you have a filter looking for unresolved bugs in v3.13.3 and some one changes the version accidently, then its out of the filter.  But with a list the inclusion condition is that at one point it was added to the list.

h2. Lists Are More Personal
Lists are more personal and/or more specific than filters.  If I create a list its because I have decided what needs to go into it.

Its not data attributes but rather human reasoning that puts issues in lists.

I figure having lists in JIRA will increase its "social value" in a sense.  A group of people can be sharing a list, and making group decisions about whats in it or not.

To this end lists should be shareable (like filters and dashboards) but also have an "editable" permisson.  Hence a list can be shared with a person/group/role and optionally have a "editable" flag also with that person/group/role.

h2. Lists Are More Transient

I can imagine lists being used in an Agile teams.

For example a "weekly iteration" can be a list, created at the start of the iteration.

Time is logged against the issues in the "iteration" list.

One could imagine that lists may be able to "add" up the time logged against the issues in them.

When the iteration ends, the list can be kept or discarded.

Unfinished tasks can be put in another "iteration" list by "dragging/copying" a list (via UI checkbox selection).

Compare this to a filter scenario.

One has to have a custom field called "Iteration" or use something like Lables.

The field needs to be set the same value in
all of the issues.

The creator of the tasks/issues has to be responsible for getting the value right to include the issues in the filter.

Then when the iteration is over, the issues need to re-edited top move them to the next iteration.  A lot of management overhead for a weeks list of tasks/issues, that are transient in nature.

h2. Lists Are More Work Process Oriented

So while fitlers may tell you what things are candidates to be done, lists can be used to make a "subset" of work you planned to do.

So from the 100 bugs you could possibly do, imagine a list of the "most important", a list of the "ones needing product management review", the ones that "you thought had been addressed before", a  "watch list", a "performance list" and so on.

So you can use lists as a.... wait for it... a TODO list.

Filters arent really TODO lists.  Once they get large that are a less useful for this function.

I can imagine that issue sin the list have a DONE status or not WITHIN the list.

So JRA-1234 might be done in list X and not done in list Y.  Contrast this with filters where once a field value is changed (say resolved) its done in all filters.

h2. Simple Features Of Lists

A list is an arbitary set of issues.
Lists have names (editable at all times like filters)
Lists are shareable
Just like filters and dashboards
Need an extra flag to idicate that those who can see the list can edit the list
They would also be "favouritable"
Anywhere you see an issue key, you get a like to add it to a list
In the issue nav / issue view page / whereever
A pop up that shows favourite list
Also the ability to start a new list at any time
List would primarily be show in portlets
Issues can be created from within the list context
Much like the sub task quick create
List can be created from other lists
The user goes into copy mode and "selects" the issues to copy across
Maybe copy to existing lists or create a new list

h2. Extended Features Of Lists

(These are less clear in my mind or are much harder)
List are sortable inside themselves
A bit like the issue navigator
Maybe by a standard set of fields
Maybe via a set of customizeable fields (like the issue nav)
Lists can be part of a project
No one owns it, the project does
Its on the Browse Project page
May create issues in a project can edit the lists (maybe not)
List would have a TODO nature for each issue in the list
So an issue in a list of DONE/NOT DONE in terms of that list
People can "check" off the issues as done
Lists can be retrieved/created via REST/SOAP
JQL could be used on a list
Select from list='list name' where x y z
fields.summary: JIRA needs support for lists of issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20608].
  {panel}

When going to the below (when you are logged out of EAC/J):

https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?jqlQuery=parent+%3D+%22SUPPORT-493%22+and+resolution+%3D+Unresolved&tempMax=1000&os_username=atlassiansupport&os_password=blah

It will show an error of "An issue with key 'SUPPORT-493' does not exist for field 'parent'", when the root cause of the issue is that the os_username and os_password combo is incorrect. 

Usually this isn't much of a big deal expect when it shows up in confluence when using the jiraissues macro and leaves poor confluence support people wondering what's wrong with parent field (which exists) when the real error is the incorrect username/pass.
fields.summary: Getting  "An issue with key 'SUPPORT-493' does not exist for field 'parent'" when the username and password is incorrect.
Redirect to Issues Moved to Separate Instance
Make the 'Create Issue' default action the 'Issue Type' select when none is remembered.
Gadget that displays issues without specifying a filter
Allow custom parameters in a user picker popup
Document a way for plugin developers to add user/group pickers in their UI

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20566].
  {panel}

The current separator character for user lists is a comma.  This presents a problem for large user bases where display names are commonly in a "surname, firstname" format for surname sorting, typically:

Birch, Jim

Where a list is displayed ambiguity arises.  This would occur in watch lists, project role lists, etc:

Birch, Jim, Yossarian, John, Major, Major, Minderbinder, Milo 

This is currently a problem for us and (I guess) others who copy user names from Active Directory.  It will become a problem for more people When Jira loads LDAP users from large directories.

Suggested remedy: use a semicolon or a configurable character.  This may already be settable but I couldn't find it. There may already be a solution in the pipeline with ldap support but it would be a nuisance if this were missed. Thanks.
fields.summary: Separator character for user lists
Provide guest / anonymous user access via SOAP / XML-RPC remote API
IE7 sometimes cuts of content when printing on the view issue page
Put the Assignee field on the Version Tracking report

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20530].
  {panel}

JIRA at Gazprombank (Russia) is now in production usage (Version: 3.13.5-#360)

During the process of putting JIRA into production we made our own Russian localization of most interfaces visible to users (not administrators). 

We would like to see the same Russian localization (our variant) in next versions of JIRA.

Being new to JIRA support resources, first I created an issue on JIRA Support site: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-53231

The file language_ru_RU.jar (with our localization) is attached to issue JSP-53231.
I can attach it here as well (if needed).

Is it possible for you to include this Russian localization into the next version of JIRA?

Regards,
Roman Volynets
fields.summary: JIRA localization for Russian language
Display unlimited rows (more than 50 rows) in 2-dimensional gadgets
Clearly state the minimum screen size in the JIRA supported platform.
Add a function which returns whether an issue has any links of a given type
Make configuring SMTP with SSL easier

fields.description:
Not sure if this is fixed in future version, please advise.
Workflow, transition add condition, choice to select User Custom Field for project issue isn't there like it is in Edit Permissions. When I select 'Condition to allow only users in a custom field-specified group to execute a transition. ' it shows fields on issue that aren't users or group fields. So I can't specify that someone that is an Implementer on the issue is able to move it via transition.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20485].
  {panel}

The message that customers receive after submitting a support request via administration in their JIRA/Confluence instances needs to be cleaned up and made more customer friendly.
or
A bug report needs to be logged that will throw an error to the customer that informs them that their email server is not configured and link them to directions that will walk them through configuring their mail server OR log a ticket through support.atlassian.com

For screen shots detailing the exact page that needs to be update please see the following [page.|https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/SUPPORT/Confirmation+of+Support+Request]
fields.summary: Clean Up Confirmation of Support Request
Option "Printable" for dashboards same as similar option for "Issue Navigator"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20470].
  {panel}

Hello,

The only thing that i did not much like in JIRA 4 is the new dashboard selector column. Usually people just have a few dashboards and thus there is just white space below the selection links. This white spaces scrambles the layout of the portlets on the right compared to the layout in JIRA3 where the portlets had more space on the screen. 

For this reason there should be some way to switch to a horizontal dashboard selector or a popup selector that that preserves the layout of portlets. This would increase acceptance of JIRA 4 in our organization.

Best regards
Dieter
fields.summary: Let user switch between horizontal and vertical dashboard selection links
Allow comments in JQL strings
Updating Issue Type Scheme sends selected options in the URL

Upgrade Velocity from 1.4.x to 1.6.x
document 'Simple Link Factory' in Web Items dev docs
Jira ships with svnkit version not supporting SASL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20386].
  {panel}

The column width should be changeable with the mouse.

If I want to rearrange the column order in the Navigator I have to
click many times on the "arrow button".

It would be easier if I can use my mouse like rearranging gadgets on the dashboard.
fields.summary: Navigator: column width changeable and rearrange columns order with the mouse

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20379].
  {panel}

We have noticed that, for instance it is possible to type in a username ending in a space into the assign issue field.

There is no validtion on this, and as a result we have issues with spaces at the end in the DB.

This causes no end of pain, expecally when you use external user management.

We solved this by trimming the username (see: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CWD-1816)

however, a better fix, would be to force jira to valida/clan usernames for all username fields as they are entered.
fields.summary: Validate Usernames when assigning/searching

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20366].
  {panel}

At this moment it only seems to be possible to deploy to the default server instance (the DAS) of a particular Glassfish domain.

In reality it is often necessary to deploy the application to a separate server instance, and not the default DAS instance.

This implies the need to not only create, start, and stop a domain, but also the need to be able to:
create a node agent.
start a node agent.
stop a node agent.
create a server instance.
start a server instance.
stop a server instance.
deploy an application to a particular server instance.

The above functionality would drastically increase productivity and the means to check in an early fase whether the domain-nodeagent-sever instance setup is correct.

Kind regards,
EDH
fields.summary: Deployment to Glassfish server instances

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20361].
  {panel}

At the moment, the XML view of a filter containing user picker custom fields only shows the user ids. For instance:

{code:xml}
...
<customfield id="customfield_10000" key="com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:multiuserpicker">
    <customfieldname>Authors</customfieldname>
        <customfieldvalues>
            <customfieldvalue>userone</customfieldvalue>
            <customfieldvalue>usertwo</customfieldvalue>
        </customfieldvalues>
    </customfield>
...
{code}

In a way, this makes sense, because the user id is the unique identifier of a user. However, there are other applications that use this information and present it to the end customer. For instance, the confluence jiraissue macro uses the XML view to present the data in the Confluence page. That results in a macro that only shows the user id, which most of the times is not meaningful to the end user.

I would be good if the customfieldvalue could be improved to return userid, username, and user profile url, so the macro could present more meaningful view to the end user.

Of course, this should not break backwards compatibility of the XML view.
fields.summary: XML view for filters containing user picker fields should return both userid and user full name
Expand JQL to support date-oriented functions (Month, Day, Year) so there is more precision
List issues on the Project Component tab page like in the Roadmap tab page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20347].
  {panel}

The XML view of the issue navigator is expensive; more expensive than RSS, Excel or Word. Currently there are two properties that can limit the reuslts:

jira.search.views.max.limit 
jira.search.views.default.max

These properties apply to _all views_. It'd be nice to be able to lower _just the XML view_ if it's having performance problems and leave the other functionality.
fields.summary: Set property for specific issue navigator view (specifically xml view)
Improve performance of XML rendering

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20341].
  {panel}

Please provide hierarchical search capability.

Example

Original Filter
project = ISS AND "Project ID" = "1555 - NYC PY10 Ann Change" AND "Work Id" IS NOT NULL AND comment !~ "##RMVerif"

Due to database having > 65000 issues that match this criteria - the following message is produced:  "The clause 'comment !~ "##RMVerif*"' is too general to perform a search. Please refine your query and try the search again."

If I remove the Comment portion of the filter and make it
project = ISS AND "Project ID" = "1555 - NYC PY10 Ann Change" AND "Work Id" IS NOT NULL
this produces @ 300 issues.

so what we really want to know is - of those 300 - which have this - comment !~ "##RMVerif"

I even tried the following
(project = ISS AND "Project ID" = "1555 - NYC PY10 Ann Change" AND "Work Id" IS NOT NULL) AND comment !~ "##RMVerif*"

(project = ISS AND "Project ID" = "1555 - NYC PY10 Ann Change" AND "Work Id" IS NOT NULL) AND NOT comment ~ "##RMVerif*"

thinking that it would perform the search with in the parens first and then based on those results look for issues where the comment was not "##RMVerif" - still no luck.
fields.summary: JQL / Filter - provide hierarchy logic

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20332].
  {panel}

Currently tip shows the same name I can see in the tab.
Makes no sense, see screenshot-1.

BTW, Menu command tip shows dashboard name + description, see screenshot-2.
IMHO, dashboard name is not needed, just description.
fields.summary: Show dashboard description, not dashboard name in the tab tip
t1
Two-Dimensional Filter Statistics Gadget should retain configuration upon encountering deleted custom field
change color of the the any filter table added from the portlet
custom field validation on submit
Two dimensional filter statistic links should display the same columns as the saved filter
When displaying more charts on one screen, colors should be same for the same type of status to avoid confusion and improve readibility
Manage Dashboard: Popularity column in "My" tab
List projects by category in create issue page
In the Issue Navigator, the multi-select field display is not wide enough to show full values
User default language dropdown should display language names in own language
Stacked Bar chart to track issue priorities over time

fields.description:
A workaround is posted here:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Changing+the+Size+of+the+Text+Area+Custom+Field
fields.summary: Apply auto-expand javascript to text customfield
A new sharing permission for "editing" filters and dashboards should be created

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20230].
  {panel}

When I use JIRA as a time tracking mechanism (eg JDOG and GreenHopper) I often want to get a report of "the time I have logged in the last week"

This would help me know if I have been keeping up to date in my logging of work.


It would be great therefore I if could get a report of "issues that have time logged against them by me".

It would look a lot like the current "project time tracking report" but per use and per "time frame" instead of per project.

My main use case is "I want to know what I have logged time against recently" so that I dont double up and also so I know if I am lagging behind.

I short this is a simple per use summary so that one cdan ensure they get a  quick view of where they are up to for the week/iteration/whatever...
fields.summary: Have a time tacking report for a user.  All time logged in the last week.
Add message/ note to reflect the status of SMTP server
Typo error in Adminstration section
Store "Smart Query" as filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20178].
  {panel}

We have a need to filter on version substrings so we can find all issues that affect a growing list of versions.

for example we have the following version strings:
4.1 (mainlatest)
4.1 (next)
4.1 rev 7.010
T 4.1 rev 7.018 
V 4.1 rev 7
C 4.1 rev 6.012

What we'd like to do is construct filters that simply use the tilde operator (contains) so we can have a filter based on the unique substring per version i.e. affectedVersion ~ "4.1 "

Currently doing a 'smart query' for v:4.1 returns the correct set of results, but we cannot save this as an auto-updating filter
fields.summary: Allow use of "contains" for affectedVersion and fixForVersions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20166].
  {panel}

In JIRA 3.13.5 and lower, it was possible to move sub-tasks from one project to another and end up with components data from the previous project after the move(JRA-17312).

Users upgrading to JIRA 4.0 and higher who use Greenhopper may experience problems as a result of corrupted data.  There is a manual fix described here:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Greenhopper+throws+NullPointerExceptions+when+components+are+corrupt...

It would be helpful to have an additional integrity check to look for and fix components that are associated with the wrong project.
fields.summary: Add a check for corrupt component data to the Integrity Checker
Make "Irrelevant" Version clickable in the Issues-Tab of a Project
Customizable Issue View Screen Layout

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20162].
  {panel}

Due to the change introduced in jira 4.0 Dashboard framework, we are not able to print the dashboard properly. we can see only one or two pages, other pages are not printing and even the charts are not able to print fully. This problem can be replicated in all browsers. But in earlier version, for example 3.13.5, there is a Print icon and print was proper. It is good to maintain the same print feature in the latest releases.

As per discussion with support developer, we decided that it is a bug in the jira 4.0 

And we have support request for this bug- https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-50228

Please find the attached dashboard PDF for reference.
fields.summary: Improve CSS on Dashboard in order to produce printing friendly content.
Documentation is not clear on the behaviour of RPC releaseVersion call
CAPTCHA Option Should Exist for The Password Reset Form

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20141].
  {panel}

One thing we have a problem with from a usability point of view (as do you I realize when entering this enhancement request) is that the number of Component/s / Versions that are available in the drop downs can be very long, making it awkward to actually select components/versions. 

I know it is possible to search by typing, but it doesn't work that well in practice any more, as we've had to prepend e.g. our components with a category to make it possible to find anything at all...

I would propose a couple of possible improvements to this, but I'm sure you can think of even better approaches - but to get you started:

1. List browser sizes should be configurable for e.g. "Create issue" screen, allowing them to be bigger - this would be a simple change, but make things much, much better than currently (only seeing 5 items is just not usable, I'd like 10-15 - having this per-user configurable would be one option).

2. Add some more sophisticated search facility that doesn't just to prefix searching, but does full string matching and restricts the displayed results, similar to how iTunes/Spotlight searches work 

3. Some sort of favorite history with a separate checkbox to "show all" for the list, with the ability to hide things over time - e.g. I'd only work with very few releases at a given point in time, although there may be a fair amount of historical releases that are still active out at customer sites and thus displayed

The main problem though, is really that the large UI workflow stumble-block, is to find the right item in these lists which can be long (we have the same problem with our "Customer" list where we assign which customer a case affects). Just as a reference, it took me probably 30-60 seconds just to find the right component to file this case for, as I had to slowly scroll through the list.
fields.summary: Better support for large selection lists (e.g. "components" in 'create issue' sccreen)
Removing system fields from the view issue screen.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20133].
  {panel}

We have clients who likes to have filter that will allow them to bring up the list of issues that they have commented on. We also think this is useful. Currently, there is no way to filter on updated by field since field is not available on the interface. It would also be nice to incorporate the time factor in to designing this feature. 
For example, I would like to see all the incidents that I have commented on (reporter and assignee could be someone else) since last 15 days.

I hope this explains what is needed.

Thanks. 
Pontis Product Development
Michael Baker Jr., Inc.
fields.summary: A way to filter the issues based on which user has commented.
New search criteria: issues that do not have sub-tasks
Fix up the RPC plugin page
See side-by-side highlighted diffs of issue text-fields in history as if they were source-code

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20109].
  {panel}

It appears that JIRA studio has this ability, however, with my JIRA standalone version 4.0 and Crucible version 2, I currently don't see a way (I expect it to be in a post function) to automatically launch a crucible review from a JIRA issue.  I want every ticket to have a review performed, thus if creating the review could be automated that would save the team a lot of time.

h3. Notes

After migrating from Studio to Standalone, the 'Ready for Review' workflow transition will no longer present as this is a Studio-specific plugin.

The following stack trace can be found within {{atlassian-jira.log}}:
{noformat}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20094].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

1 Open some issue for view.
2 Add "Link" to another issue and set its type to "depends" for instance.
3 Try to change link type from "depends" to "duplicate"
4 YOU CAN'T 

Expected result:
     You can change Link Type any time.
fields.summary: Cannot change link type after creating.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20092].
  {panel}

Steps:
1. Login to JIRA and create a permission scheme.
2. Set browse project permission as "Current Assignee"
3. Please refer to permission screenshot for other permissions.
4. Associate the permission scheme to a issue and create a issue and sub task.
5. Login user can assign issues.
6. Assign the sub task to some other user.

Result:
1. User gets a big error message "It seems that you have tried to perform an operation which you are not permitted to perform." though the issue is currently assigned to the other user.
2. It seems that after assigning the user when JIRA try to show the issue, its unable to do due to permission and give this error message which is misleading.
3. Giving browse permission to all users solve the issue but its important as "Current Assignee" is an option in permission list.

Expected:
1. No error message and scenario should be handled gracefully.
fields.summary: JIRA gives a permission error while assigning issues if browse permission is set only to "Current Assignable"
How to fix a single ticket workflow using the backend database change?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20075].
  {panel}

Activity stream dies with: An internal server error occurred when requesting resource http://localhost:8080/plugins/servlet/streams?os_authType=basic&maxResults=100.

See attached image for screen shot of this error.

This appears to be caused by an issue that has CMYK JPEG's attached.

Some exceptions seen in the logs:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20053].
  {panel}

Clarify the instructions on moving/removing the JavaMail JARs in the SMTP configuration:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+JIRA+to+Send+SMTP+Mail
http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.13.5/smtpconfig.html

We should instruct people to check for the existence of the JARs in the app server and move/replace accordingly, rather than giving them specific instructions based on their specific app server.

Reason: Some operating systems, such as Red Hat Enterprise Linux, ship the JARS with Tomcat while most do not. So we cannot base the instructions on the specific app server.

_Info:_ I have already updated the instructions on CAC:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+JIRA+to+Send+SMTP+Mail

To be done: Update the instructions for JIRA 3.13 -- as requested by a customer:
http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.13.5/smtpconfig.html
fields.summary: Clarify instructions on moving/removing JavaMail classes in SMTP config

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20037].
  {panel}

Many of my uers are requesting the ability to perform the following

Change Condition - a field changes from any value to any value (including ablity to specify values that change) - at any point in time - not just the latest change. This information is displayed in the change history.

Modified Date - between 7 and 0 days ago - basically to allow both a concept of "today() functionality and "today()" and a range of dates.

Change Author user or current user - change author at a given time - not the user to last update.

Record changed between 11/30/09 and 12/07/09 and authored by Smith, David W
and Status != Closed - again not the user to last update.

This is severely limiting research capabilities of our users as out legacy product had this ability.
fields.summary: Change Condition/History Search Ability
Administrator mail queue should show the addressee of the email
where to find deployment documentation for Jira and Conflucence on Websphere Application Server 7 ?
Datepicker - pop up calender resizes due to long text
When moving issue, confirmation should be skipped if no fields will be changed
Make website icons transparent.
Project gadget: "Resolved Recently" filter should use the new Resolution system field
Make REST calls to "rest/api/1.0/dropdowns" and "rest/api/1.0/header-separator" serve using the ".png" extension.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-19961].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Editing existing Work logs while having 'Adjust Automatically' selected causes the Estimations to be calculated differently than expected.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
*Scenario 1*
# Create a Task with an Original Estimate of 6 hours
# Log 8 hours of work
# Edit the work logged to 6 hours

*Scenario 2*
# Create a task with no Original Estimate
# Log 8 hours of work
# Edit the work log down to 2 hours of work

h3. Expected Results
Scenario 1: Results in 0 hours remaining
Scenario 2: Results in 0 hours remaining

h3. Actual Results
Scenario 1: Results in 2 hours remaining
Scenario 2: Results in 6 hours remaining

h3.Workaround
Do not use Automatic calculation, manually enter what time remains.




 
 
_Original Description_
{quote}
The remaining estimate field is incorrect in the following situation:

    * Task entered with original Estimate of 6 hrs
    * Worklog entered (8 hrs)
    * Worklog edited down to 6 hrs

After doing this:

Original Estimate = 6 hrs
Time Spent = 6 hrs
Remaining Estimate = 2 hrs

In this situation, shouldn't the remaining estimate be 0 hrs?{quote}
fields.summary: Remaining estimate is inconsistent when editing a worklog down

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-19957].
  {panel}

Regarding the default/internal MailListener, the documentation states:

This listener is usually always turned on in JIRA - see Email Notifications for more details. If you want to write more complex or more specific notifications, you can disable the internal MailListener and add your own.

However, as the MailListener is marked as 'internal', it is not possible to be remove it. 

At present, it is necessary to recompile the MailListener class and set isInternal to false.

Need to allow users to delete/remove the MailListener through UI.
fields.summary: Unable to delete the default/internal MailListener
Changing custom field types
Trim the name of projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-19934].
  {panel}

Allow relative searches in JQL (eg: issues which were updated within 2 hours of the issue creation date)


I would like to request this feature as it would help us massively when doing reporting for SLA violations etc.

Scenario1
============
Issue creation 1st Jan 2009 at 10 am and issue was updated 1st Jan 2009 at 11.30 am.

In that case If I do a search on 31st January.(End of month) how can I search for the issues which were updated same day as the creation date (within 2 hours of creation time)
fields.summary: Allow relative searches in JQL
plugin to prevent issues from being closed when no time is logged?
Improve documentation for "params" map of IssueEvent

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-19911].
  {panel}

*User Stories* 

* As a JIRA user I want to run reports of all tasks and their associated sub-tasks
* As a JIRA user I want to create a filter to show only tasks and their sub-tasks.
* As a JIRA user I want to create a filter to show only new features and their sub-tasks.
* As a JIRA user I want to create a filter to show only bugs and their sub-tasks.
* As a Green Hopper user I want to create a filter using issue type sub-task with parent issues type of Tasks so that I can see a chart with tasks and their sub-tasks.

I've used the user stories to explain our need. We are creating different types of issues (new features, improvements, tasks and bugs) with sub-tasks and I need to be able to create filters to show just the issue type with their sub tasks.
fields.summary: Allow filtering of sub-task issues by the parent issue type
